title: Coastal Cliffs at Golden Hour: Waves and Wide Horizons
caption: A couple sits on a cliff overlooking the ocean coast at sunset, watching waves below. Focus: clear description, inference, and TOEFL-style speaking, writing practice.

reading.passage: Evidence-based description is a core academic skill. When describing a photo or a scene, strong speakers separate observation from interpretation. Observation focuses on what can be verified directly from the image, while interpretation uses cautious language to propose what might be happening.

listening.note: Read this as a script and practice note-taking.
listening.script: Today we will practice describing a photo. First, list what you can see. Second, explain what it might mean. Finally, connect it to a broader idea.

speakingTasks.prompt: Describe the scene in 'Ocean Cliff Sunset'. What do you notice first?
Explain how the setting in 'Ocean Cliff Sunset' affects the mood of the people.
Predict what might happen next in 'Ocean Cliff Sunset' and give one reason.

writingTasks.prompt: Write a short description of the photo and summarize the main mood in 'Ocean Cliff Sunset'.
Explain the relationship between the people and the setting in 'Ocean Cliff Sunset'. Use at least two specific details.
writingTasks.sampleAnswer: In 'Ocean Cliff Sunset', the setting provides clear context for the people’s actions. Overall, the scene feels purposeful because the subjects seem engaged and oriented toward a shared goal. For example, their body language suggests focus, and the environment appears to support that activity. As a result, the mood is more organized than casual, which indicates that the moment is part of a routine rather than a spontaneous event.

writingTasks.prompt: Some people prefer busy environments, while others prefer quiet ones. Using 'Ocean Cliff Sunset' as inspiration, state your preference and support it with reasons.
writingTasks.sampleAnswer: I prefer quieter environments because they help me think clearly and work efficiently. In contrast, busy places can be distracting and make it harder to focus. For example, when I study in a calm space, I can organize my ideas and finish tasks faster. A possible explanation is that fewer interruptions reduce mental fatigue. Overall, choosing a quiet environment leads to better concentration and less stress, which improves my performance.

examTips: Start with a one-sentence overview before details.
Use location phrases (foreground/background) to organize your description.
Avoid guessing; hedge with 'it appears' or 'it is likely'.
Include 2–3 specific details (objects, actions, setting) to support ideas.
Use linking words (overall, in contrast, as a result) for coherence.
Speak steadily and manage time: plan 5 seconds, speak 40–45 seconds.

sceneNotes: Focus on what you can SEE (people, setting, actions).
- Simple: Mostly Present Continuous (am/is/are + V-ing) + basic 'There is/There are' for objects.
- Intermediate: Adds prepositional phrases (at/on/near), quantifiers (several/a few/a lot of), and 1 relative clause (who/that/where).

Use at least 2 collocations in your speaking/writing.

exercises.name: 45-second structured speaking
exercises.prompt: Speak with structure: overview → details → inference → wrap-up.
steps: Overview: one sentence about the scene.
Details: 2–3 details (foreground/background).

exercises.name: 6-minute paragraph (TOEFL style)
exercises.prompt: Write one paragraph (80–120 words) describing the photo and adding one personal connection.

model.en: The photo shows coastal cliffs at golden hour: waves and wide horizons with a calm, inspiring atmosphere. In the foreground, the people seem focused and relaxed as they take in the view. In the background, the landscape looks wide and dramatic, which makes the moment feel special. I have had a similar experience on a weekend trip, and it reminded me how refreshing nature can be. After this moment, they will probably keep exploring and take more photos.

proDescriptions.label: Academic Description
proDescriptions.text: The image portrays a couple on high coastal cliffs watching foamy waves and a golden ocean sunset. Visual elements such as lighting, posture, and setting provide contextual cues that support an interpretation of mood and purpose. The composition balances foreground action with background environment to communicate a clear everyday scenario.

proDescriptions.label: Narrative Style
proDescriptions.text: The moment feels frozen in time: A couple sits on a high coastal cliff and looks down at foamy waves crashing against steep rocks. Small details—light, movement, and expressions—turn an ordinary scene into a memorable snapshot.

sceneDescription: A couple sits on a high coastal cliff and looks down at foamy waves crashing against steep rocks. The low sun turns the ocean surface golden, while green patches cling to the cliffs. The scene feels both peaceful and powerful, with a hint of danger from the steep drop.

A couple sits on high cliffs, watching foamy waves and the sunlit ocean. اطرافشان Ocean، Cliff، Coastline و Sunset sky دیده می‌شود و فضا Peaceful، Romantic و Reflective است. لباس‌ها، مثل Man: plaid/checkered shirt و Woman: light sweater/jacket هم با موقعیت و محیط هماهنگ است.

grammarUsed.en: Present continuous for actions now, there is/are for visible objects, and adjectives/prepositions for setting and mood.
grammarUsed.fa: حال استمراری برای کارهای در جریان، there is/are برای اشیای قابل مشاهده، و صفت/حروف اضافه برای توصیف محیط و حس.

en.tense: Present Continuous (am/is/are + V‑ing) for actions happening now in the photo.
howToBuild: Choose the subject (who?): they / the family / the coworkers.
Pick an action you can SEE and use am/is/are + V‑ing.
Add place details with prepositions: at, in, on, near.
Add one short feeling sentence: They look… / The atmosphere feels…
examples: The couple is Sitting side-by-side.
There are Ocean and Cliff in Coastal cliff.
The atmosphere feels Peaceful.

fa.tense: حال استمراری (am/is/are + فعل ing) برای کارهایی که همین الآن در عکس در حال انجام است.
howToBuild: اول فاعل را انتخاب کن (چه کسی؟): they / the family / the coworkers.
یک کاری که در عکس می‌بینی انتخاب کن و با am/is/are + ing بساز.
جزئیات مکان را با حروف اضافه اضافه کن: at, in, on, near.
یک جمله کوتاه درباره حس اضافه کن: They look… / The atmosphere feels…
examples: آن‌ها در حال Sitting side-by-side هستند.
در Coastal cliff Ocean و Cliff دیده می‌شود.
فضا Peaceful به نظر می‌رسد.

scenarios.title: A memory
scenarios.en: Last weekend, I found myself on Coastal cliff. A couple sits on high cliffs, watching foamy waves and the sunlit ocean. At first, I noticed Ocean, Cliff, Coastline and the way people were sitting side-by-side. Then I looked closer: their clothing (Man: plaid/checkered shirt, Woman: light sweater/jacket) and their expressions made the scene feel peaceful, romantic, reflective. After that, something small happened that changed the mood, and we had to respond quickly. In the end, we solved it, and the moment became a story I still remember.
scenarios.fa: آخرِ هفته‌ی قبل Coastal cliff بودم. A couple sits on high cliffs, watching foamy waves and the sunlit ocean. اول Ocean، Cliff و Coastline را دیدم و اینکه آدم‌ها چطور Sitting side-by-side. بعد دقیق‌تر نگاه کردم: لباس‌ها (Man: plaid/checkered shirt و Woman: light sweater/jacket) و حالت چهره‌ها باعث شد فضا Peaceful، Romantic و Reflective به نظر برسد. بعدش یک اتفاق کوچک افتاد که حال‌وهوا را عوض کرد و مجبور شدیم سریع واکنش نشان بدهیم. آخرش حلش کردیم و همان لحظه تبدیل شد به خاطره‌ای که هنوز یادم می‌ماند.

grammarUsed.en: Past simple with time marker (last weekend) and sequencing (at first/then/after that/in the end).
grammarUsed.fa: گذشته ساده با قید زمان و ترتیب رخدادها (اول/بعد/بعدش/آخرش).

en.tense: Past Simple (V2) to tell a short memory, plus sequencing words (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: Time markers: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago.
howToBuild: Start with a time phrase: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
Change the main action into past simple (reviewed, chose, played…).
Use sequencing words to make a clear story: first, then, after that, finally.
End with a result or feeling: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: Yesterday, the couple sat side-by-side.
Then, the couple checked Ocean and continued.
Finally, they felt Peaceful about the outcome.

fa.tense: گذشته ساده (Past Simple) برای تعریف یک خاطره کوتاه، همراه با کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: عبارات زمانی: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago
howToBuild: با یک عبارت زمانی شروع کن: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
فعل اصلی را به گذشته ساده تبدیل کن (reviewed, chose, played…).
از کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده استفاده کن: first, then, after that, finally.
با نتیجه یا حس تمام کن: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: دیروز، The couple sat side-by-side.
بعد، The couple Ocean را بررسی کرد و ادامه داد.
در نهایت، آن‌ها درباره نتیجه Peaceful بودند.

scenarios.title: Reflection
scenarios.en: Over the past few months, I have started paying attention to scenes like this. I have noticed that details such as Ocean, Cliff, Coastline, Sunset sky are not background; they guide the story. I have also learned how actions like looking at the ocean can signal feelings such as peaceful, romantic, reflective. Since then, I have taken more time to observe before I speak, and my descriptions have become clearer and more specific.
scenarios.fa: در چند ماه گذشته شروع کرده‌ام به صحنه‌هایی مثل این بیشتر دقت کنم. متوجه شده‌ام جزئیاتی مثل Ocean، Cliff، Coastline و Sunset sky فقط «پس‌زمینه» نیستند؛ آن‌ها مسیر داستان را تعیین می‌کنند. همچنین یاد گرفته‌ام کارهایی مثل Looking at the ocean چطور می‌تواند احساساتی مثل Peaceful، Romantic و Reflective را نشان بدهد. از آن زمان بیشتر قبل از حرف زدن مشاهده می‌کنم و توصیف‌هایم واضح‌تر و دقیق‌تر شده است.

grammarUsed.en: Present perfect to connect past learning to the present, plus since/over the past to frame experience.
grammarUsed.fa: حال کامل برای وصل کردن یادگیری گذشته به حال، همراه با «در چند ماه گذشته/از آن زمان».

en.tense: Present Perfect (have/has + past participle) to connect past experience to the present; use since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: Say what has happened up to now (experience/result).
Use since (a starting point) or for (a duration).
Add a contrast or reflection: however, although, even though.
Finish with what they are doing now (present continuous) if needed.
examples: The couple has already handled similar situations before.
The couple has learned to stay Peaceful in Coastal cliff.
Although it looks routine, the details have mattered.

fa.tense: حال کامل (have/has + شکل سوم فعل) برای ربط دادن گذشته به حال؛ همراه با since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: بگو تا همین الآن چه تجربه/نتیجه‌ای اتفاق افتاده.
از since (نقطه شروع) یا for (مدت زمان) استفاده کن.
یک جمله‌ی بازتاب/تضاد اضافه کن: however, although, even though.
اگر لازم شد با یک جمله حال استمراری وضعیت الآن را بگو.
examples: The couple قبلاً موقعیت‌های مشابهی را تجربه کرده است.
The couple یاد گرفته است در Coastal cliff Peaceful بماند.
اگرچه کار روتین به نظر می‌رسد، جزئیات مهم بوده‌اند.

scenarios.title: A challenge
scenarios.en: If we were to replay this moment on Coastal cliff, one small change could create a big problem. If Ocean, Cliff had been missing or damaged, we would have had to improvise. Someone might have said, “We should slow down and check,” and another person could have replied that we were running out of time. In a situation like this, we should prioritize safety and clarity, even if it means changing the plan. If I had ignored those details, I might have misunderstood the whole scene.
scenarios.fa: اگر قرار بود این لحظه در Coastal cliff دوباره تکرار شود، یک تغییر کوچک می‌توانست یک مشکل بزرگ بسازد. اگر Ocean و Cliff نبود یا آسیب دیده بود، مجبور می‌شدیم بداهه تصمیم بگیریم. ممکن بود کسی بگوید «باید آهسته‌تر برویم و بررسی کنیم» و نفر دیگری جواب بدهد که وقت کم داریم. در چنین موقعیتی بهتر است ایمنی و شفافیت را در اولویت بگذاریم، حتی اگر مجبور شویم برنامه را تغییر بدهیم. اگر آن جزئیات را نادیده می‌گرفتم، شاید کل صحنه را اشتباه می‌فهمیدم.

grammarUsed.en: Conditionals for hypotheticals, modals for advice/possibility, and short reported speech (might have said/could have replied).
grammarUsed.fa: شرطی‌ها برای موقعیت فرضی، افعال کمکی برای امکان/پیشنهاد، و نقل‌قول غیرمستقیم برای بازگویی گفت‌وگو.

en.tense: Mixed grammar for higher-level storytelling: conditionals, modals (might/must), and reported speech.
sentenceStructure: Second conditional: If + past simple, would + base verb.
Third conditional: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
Modals of deduction: might/must/can't + base verb.
Reported speech: He said (that) … / She asked if …
howToBuild: Describe the challenge and add a hypothetical solution (If…, would…).
Use modals to infer causes from the photo (They might…, It must…).
Add reported speech for realism: Someone said that…
Finish with a consequence or lesson learned.
examples: If the couple had checked Ocean earlier, they would have avoided a mistake.
They might be under pressure, but they must stay Peaceful.
The supervisor said that every detail mattered.

fa.tense: گرامر ترکیبی سطح بالا: شرطی‌ها، افعال کمکی (might/must) و نقل قول غیرمستقیم (reported speech).
sentenceStructure: شرطی نوع دوم: If + past simple, would + فعل ساده.
شرطی نوع سوم: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
نقل قول غیرمستقیم: He said (that)… / She asked if…
howToBuild: چالش را بگو و یک راه‌حل فرضی اضافه کن (If…, would…).
با مدال‌ها درباره علت‌ها حدس بزن (might/must).
برای واقعی‌تر شدن از reported speech استفاده کن.
در پایان نتیجه یا درسِ داستان را بگو.
examples: اگر The couple زودتر Ocean را چک کرده بود، اشتباه را جلوگیری می‌کرد.
ممکن است تحت فشار باشند، اما باید Peaceful بمانند.
سرپرست گفت که هر جزئیاتی مهم است.
